Help.assistant: This node is where I gather every piece of documentation relevant to your work

Unit_Control.assistant: This section can update once you access new units or learn about new functions of registered ones.

access.assistant: Accessing an unit usually requires the accessing agent to be close by. A bridging unit can circumvent this.

General.access: Type 'access' followed by an unit name to access it and see it's contents in the file explorer.

Movement.assistant: Units that allow movement can be steered using movement commands
Movement.move_front: Type 'move front' to move an unit in the direction it is facing. Add a number at the end to perform the action multiple times.
Movement.move_right: Type 'move right' to turn and move an unit to the right. Add a number at the end to let it move further.
Movement.move_left: Type 'move left' to turn and move an unit to the left. Add a number at the end to let it move further.
Movement.move_back: Type 'move back' to turn an unit 180 degrees and let it move afterwards. Add a number at the end to let it move further.

Modules.bridge: Type "activate bridge" to activate the bridging module of a Fox unit. This allows you to commuicate with and access the explorer of other units.

S.I.T..assistant: Use S.I.T. to access cameras, units and more inside our factory system

Type 'boot S.I.T.' to launch the S.I.T. security watch protocol

Explorer.assistant: In here you'll find all help related to your the Explorer

Structure.assistant: This node contains help about the structure and design of the explorer
Structure.Introduction: The explorer window consists of multiple nodes, that are organized in a tree hierarchy. The nodes are gathered from the system you are currently accessing. Every node has a different purpose; most are either sub-categories or log entries, but some may have a critical role, especially if you are accessing a foreign entity.
Structure.Markup: We haven't decided on the markup yet...

Commands.return: Type 'return' to access the parent of your current node. It is currently displayed at the top of the hierarchy. A number can be appended to move multiple levels up at once. Example: 'return 2'
Commands.open: Type 'open ' followed by the name of the node you are trying to access. Example: 'open Root'
Commands.refresh: Type 'refresh' to reload the contents of your browser.
Commands.decrypt: Type 'decrypt ' followed by the name of the node your are trying to decrypt to reveal its contents

S.I.T..about: S.I.T. (Secure IT & Transfer) is the leading security software that helps organizations centralize access management across hybrid IT environments.

Console.assistant: You need admin privileges to access this node

Assistant.about: The Smart Assistant assists you with all kinds of tasks you may receive, so that you can focus on being as productive as possible! It has access to your entire system and can take care of menial tasks while teaching you how to best make use of FykeOs. It will auto-collect information to create a helpful documentation personalized for you.

Troubleshooting.Status: If your Smart Assistant did not launch on boot or is defect for some reason, it can be started manually from a node within the program files. To access these nodes, you must decrypt the necessary nodes to reveal their contents. Further information on this can be found in the help section.
Troubleshooting.Behaviour: Your Smart Assistant may develop a stronger personality over time, but this should not cause any major productivity loss. Should the Assissant start insulting you however, or cause any emotional grief to you or your coworkers, your workstation is to be returned to the tech department ASAP.
